level.text: Beginning in 2013, within 45 days of the end of each Council year, the Council shall compile and publish online the District of Columbia Statutes-at-Large which shall include in separate chronological order:
Council acts, including emergency acts adopted after December 31, 1986, which become law during that Council year; and
Council resolutions adopted during that Council year, except ceremonial resolutions adopted after December 31, 1986.
The 1st publication of the District of Columbia Statutes-at-Large shall also contain in a separate part each regulation and resolution of the District of Columbia Council in chronological order.

The District of Columbia Statutes-at-Large shall contain a certificate by the General Counsel to the Council of the District of Columbia stating that it contains all the documents required to be published pursuant to this section as of the date of the certificate.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: The 2012 amendment by D.C. Law 19-168, in the introductory language of (a), added "Beginning in 2013," substituted "the Council" for "the Mayor," and substituted "publish online" for "publish"; repealed (c), which read: "The Mayor shall make copies of the District of Columbia Statutes-at-Large available to the public at a reasonable cost calculated to cover the costs of its compilation, publication, and distribution"; and added (d).

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 1-19
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 1-19, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 2-601.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 2-153
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 2-153, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 2-611.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 7-78
level.text: Law 7-78 was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 7-179, which was referred to the Committee of the Whole. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on October 27, 1987 and November 10, 1987, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on November 24, 1987, it was assigned Act No. 7-113 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 19-168
level.text: Law 19-168, the "Fiscal Year 2013 Budget Support Act of 2012," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 19-743. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on May 15, 2012, and June 5, 2012, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on June 22, 2012, it was assigned Act No. 19-385 and transmitted to Congress for its review. D.C. Law 19-168 became effective on September 20, 2012.
